Articles.Content:
I am looking for a Mk 3 SSTO that is capable of delivering an entire long cargo bay's worth of cargo to orbit, rendezvous, and return. 

All of my attempts have ended in disaster. (I wonder why....) 

SSTO Requirements:

Orange Tank to orbit

Looks good ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Mk 3 parts

On a side note, I noticed that the new large wings don't have any matching wing connectors. Is there a mod for Mk 3 wing connectors?

I made one! Have fun with it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) download link in this thread [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121684-The-MONSTER-130-ton-ssto-that-can-take-a-full-orange-tank-to-orbit%21](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121684-The-MONSTER-130-ton-ssto-that-can-take-a-full-orange-tank-to-orbit%21)

What on Kerbin...... It's HUGE!!!

Does it work if I replace the front adapter and pod with a Mk 4 cockpit?

I dOnt know, it might throw the center of mass off balence. What you could do is replace the adtapter with the equal fuel sized normal shape mk3 tank, and then put your shuttle cockpit on that. Bearing in mind to reenter and fly to land after having used up fuel, you will have to pump the fuel around as the diagram in my thread shows. This will prevent flatspins and other craziness.

- - - Updated - - -

I could have done this I suppose but I liked the pointyness of the design ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) and of course you cab still put the pointy thing back on to the shuttle cockpit for a laugh

Something similar would work in stock. That exact ship...maybe, maybe not.

Give it a go and see. The streamlined LF tanks hung on the sides of the fuselage and the wings are for aero purposes that don't apply in stock; ditching those would probably help it in stock.
